table.name: action_taken
table.remarks: Contains information about who the call centre staff contacted and when to allow Officers to know who to follow up with and/or if someone else is already taking action.

column.name: action_taken_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an action taken record. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC. Format is YY-###### where the number portion of the sequence resets to 0 on the new year. Either a complaint_update_guid or a complaint_identifier must be present on the record.

column.name: complaint_update_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a COMPLAINT_UPDATE. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables. Either a complaint_update_guid or a complaint_identifier must be present on the record.

column.name: action_details_txt
column.remarks: Text about who the call centre staff contacted and when

column.name: logged_by_txt
column.remarks: The name of the webEOC User that recorded the ACTION_TAKEN

column.name: action_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The date from webEOC that the ACTION_TAKEN was recorded. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the ACTION_TAKEN

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ACTION_TAKEN was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the ACTION_TAKEN

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the ACTION_TAKEN was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((complaint_identifier IS NOT NULL) OR (complaint_update_guid IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: action_taken_check

table.name: action_taken_h
table.remarks: History table for complaint table

column.name: h_action_taken_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: allegation_complaint
table.remarks: A complaint for which a caller believes that a Violation has occurred and should be investigated.

column.name: allegation_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an allegation complaint. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: in_progress_ind
column.remarks: True if the alleged violation is currently described as being in progress. False otherwise.

column.name: observed_ind
column.remarks: True if the alleged violation was observed first hand. False otherwise.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the allegation complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the allegation complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the allegation complaint.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the allegation complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC.

column.name: violation_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a violation.

table.name: allegation_complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for allegation_complaint table

column.name: h_algtncmplt_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for allegation complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the allegation complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the allegation complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the allegation complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: app_user_complaint_xref
table.remarks: Links app users to complaints with a specific relationship type (assignee, collaborator, suspect, etc.)

column.name: app_user_complaint_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for the app user complaint cross-reference.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC. Format is YY-###### where the number portion of the sequence resets to 0 on the new year.

column.name: app_user_complaint_xref_code
column.remarks: The type of relationship between the app user and complaint (ASSIGNEE, COLLABORATOR, SUSPECT, etc.)

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the relationship between a person and a complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship between a person and a complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the relationship between a person and a complaint .

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship between a person and a complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the relationship type between a person and a complaint code is active.

column.name: app_user_guid_ref
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a user. References the user table in the shared schema.

table.name: app_user_complaint_xref_code
table.remarks: Code table defining the types of relationships between app users and complaints

column.name: app_user_complaint_xref_code
column.remarks: Code identifying the type of app user-complaint relationship (ASSIGNEE, COLLABORATOR, SUSPECT, etc.)

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the relationship type between a person and a complaint.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the relationship type between a person and a complaint.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the relationship type between a person and a complaint code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the relationship type between a person and a complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship type between a person and a complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the relationship type between a person and a complaint .

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship type between a person and a complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: app_user_complaint_xref_h
table.remarks: History table for app_user_complaint_xref

column.name: h_app_user_complaint_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for app user complaint cross-reference history.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the person and complaint mapping that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: attractant_code
table.remarks: A human factor contributing to a Human Wildlife Conflict (E.g. RESFRUIT = Residential Fruit/Berries; LVSFEED = Livestock Feed)

column.name: attractant_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an attractant.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the attractant code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the attractant code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the attractant code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the attractant code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the attractant code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the attractant code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: attractant_hwcr_xref
table.remarks: Cross reference table for linking attractants to HWCR Complaints.

column.name: attractant_hwcr_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an attractant hwcr relationship. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: attractant_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an attractant.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a hwcr complaint.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant hwcr cross reference was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant hwcr cross reference was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: attractant_hwcr_xref_h
table.remarks: History table for attractant_hwcr_xref table

column.name: h_attrhwcrx_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for attractant hwcr xref history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the attractant hwcr xref that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the attractant hwcr xref table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the attractant hwcr xref table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: comp_mthd_recv_cd_agcy_cd_xref
table.remarks: complaint_method_received_code and AGENCIES that allow for features to be displayed or hidden as required.

column.name: agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. Used to map methods complaints are received to NatSuite agencies as the users were not able to standardize on a common list.

column.name: complaint_method_received_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint_method_received_code that is controlled by the comp_mthd_recv_cd_agcy_cd_xref table.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the complaint_method_received_code should be rendered the for users in the given AGENCY

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint_method_received_code / AGENCY mapping.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint_method_received_code / AGENCY mapping was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint_method_received_code / AGENCY mapping

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint_method_received_code / AGENCY mapping was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: complaint
table.remarks: Initial information provided on a potential incident.

column.name: detail_text
column.remarks: Verbatim details of the complaint as recorded by the call centre or through the web form.

column.name: caller_name
column.remarks: The name provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_address
column.remarks: The address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_email
column.remarks: The email address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_1
column.remarks: The primary phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_2
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_3
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: location_summary_text
column.remarks: A brief summary of the location of the complaint.

column.name: location_detailed_text
column.remarks: A more detailed description of the location of the complaint.

column.name: incident_utc_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time at which the complaint occurred.

column.name: incident_reported_utc_timestmp
column.remarks: The date and time at which the complaint was reported.

column.name: reported_by_other_text
column.remarks: Provides a more detailed description when the referred by Agency is of type "OTHER"

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: reported_by_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that originally referred the complaint.

column.name: owned_by_agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency that currently owns the complaint.

column.name: complaint_status_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint status.

column.name: geo_organization_unit_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit. The finest known grain geographical organization unit where the complaint occurred.

column.name: location_geometry_point
column.remarks: The closest approximation to where the incident occurred. Stored as a geometric point using the EPSG:3005 Projected Coordinate System (BC Albers)

column.name: webeoc_identifier
column.remarks: Unique Identifier from the webEOC source system to identify a complaint update. This is required as the natural key is not available in all webEOC APIs

column.name: comp_mthd_recv_cd_agcy_cd_xref_guid
column.remarks: Methods in which the complaint was received. Examples include: DGIR forward, Direct email or phone call,Minister's office,RAPP ,Referral

column.name: is_privacy_requested
column.remarks: flag to represent that the caller has asked for special care when handling their personal information

column.name: reference_number
column.remarks: Allows users to link complaints to files in external systems. Currently labeled in the system as COORS reference number and initially only used for COORS linkages.

column.name: comp_last_upd_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The time the complaint was last updated, or null if the complaint has never been touched. This value might also be updated by business logic that touches sub-tables to indicate that the business object complaint has been updated.

column.name: complaint_type_code
column.remarks: The type of the complaint, such as HWCR, GIR, or ERS.

table.name: complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for complaint table

column.name: h_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: complaint_method_received_code
table.remarks: Methods in which the complaint was received. Examples include: DGIR forward, Direct email or phone call,Minister's office,RAPP ,Referral

column.name: complaint_method_received_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to define the method in which the complaint was received

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of a METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of a METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE is active

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the wdr schedule code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the METHOD_COMPLAINT_RECEIVED_CODE was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: complaint_referral
table.remarks: Used to track complaint refer actions from an agency to a different agency.

column.name: complaint_referral_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for the referral action.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint being referred.

column.name: referred_by_agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency that a complaint being referred from.

column.name: referred_to_agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency that a complaint is referred to.

column.name: referral_date
column.remarks: The timestamp when referring a complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no offset.

column.name: referral_reason
column.remarks: The reason why refer a complaint.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that refer a complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when referring a complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated referring a complaint.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when referring a complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if refer complaint feature is active.

column.name: app_user_guid_ref
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a user. References the user table in the shared schema.

table.name: complaint_referral_email_log
table.remarks: Used to track additional emails that were added to a specific complaint referral in order to maintain an audit trail. This table does not track emails sent to the default email for an agency which is stored in the email reference table as this can be inferred from the complaint referral table.

column.name: complaint_referral_email_log_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for the referral email log action.

column.name: complaint_referral_guid
column.remarks: Foreign key to system generated unique key for the complaint referral.

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: An additional email address entered by a user that they have indicated the complaint should be referred to.

column.name: email_sent_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the email was sent. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the email reference record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when email reference was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated email reference.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when email reference was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: complaint_status_code
table.remarks: The status of a Values include OPEN = Open and CLOSED = Closed.

column.name: complaint_status_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint status.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the complaint status code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the complaint status code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the complaint status code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the complaint status code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint status code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint status code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint status code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint status code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: manually_assignable_ind
column.remarks: Indicates if the stastus code can be manually assigned by a user.

column.name: agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency that defines the complaint type

table.name: complaint_update
table.remarks: Callers will sometimes call in with a COMPLAINT_UPDATE. This table is used to track items that are considered to be amendments to the complaint information such as additional details, or location information.

column.name: complaint_update_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a complaint update. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC. Format is YY-250744772125074477212507447721 where the number portion of the sequence resets to 0 on the new year.

column.name: update_seq_number
column.remarks: An integer that is used to reflect the order that complaint updates were entered into the call center system.

column.name: upd_detail_text
column.remarks: Verbatim details of the complaint as recorded by the call centre or through the web form.

column.name: upd_location_summary_text
column.remarks: A brief summary of the location of the complaint.

column.name: upd_location_detailed_text
column.remarks: A more detailed description of the location of the complaint.

column.name: upd_location_geometry_point
column.remarks: The closest approximation to where the incident occurred. Stored as a geometric point using the EPSG:3005 Projected Coordinate System (BC Albers)

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint update record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint update record was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint update record.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint_update record was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: webeoc_identifier
column.remarks: Unique Identifier from the webEOC source system to identify a complaint update. This is required as the natural key is not available in all webEOC APIs

column.name: upd_caller_name
column.remarks: The name provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_caller_phone_1
column.remarks: The primary phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_caller_phone_2
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_caller_phone_3
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_caller_address
column.remarks: The address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_caller_email
column.remarks: The email address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: upd_reported_by_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that originally referred the updated complaint.

column.name: upd_reported_by_other_text
column.remarks: Provides a more detailed description when the referred by Agency is of type "OTHER"

table.name: complaint_update_h
table.remarks: History table for complaint_update table

column.name: h_complaint_update_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for complaint update history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the complaint update that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the complaint update table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the complaint update table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: configuration
table.remarks: The configuration table is used to store constants which are expected to change over the lifecycle of the application, or have different values in different environments. By making changes to in the database the behaviour of the application can be altered without requiring a full deployment.

column.name: configuration_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an configuration entry.

column.name: configuration_value
column.remarks: The value of the configuration entry.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the configuration entry.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the configuration_entry is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the configuration entry.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the configuration entry was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the configuration entry.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the configuration entry was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: configuration_h
table.remarks: History table for configuration table

column.name: h_configuration_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for configuration history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the configuration that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the configuration table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the configuration table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: email_reference
table.remarks: Used to track shared email addresses used by various agencies.

column.name: email_reference_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for the referral action.

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: The email address used by parties referenced by this record.

column.name: agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency that the email address belongs to.

column.name: geo_organization_unit_code
column.remarks: The geographic organization code that the email address belongs to.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the email reference record.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when email reference was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated email reference.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when email reference was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the email reference is active.

table.name: feature_agency_xref
table.remarks: Maintains a mapping between FEATURES and AGENCIES that allow for features to be displayed or hidden as required.

column.name: feature_agency_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a FEATURE_AGENCY_XREF ecord. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: feature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a FEATURE that is controlled by the FEATURE_AGENCY_XREF table.

column.name: agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. The agency for which the feature is either enabled or disabled.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the FEATURE should be rendered the for users in the given AGENCY

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the FEATURE / AGENCY mapping.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the FEATURE / AGENCY mapping was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the FEATURE / AGENCY mapping

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the FEATURE / AGENCY mapping was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: feature_code
table.remarks: A list of FEATUREs that can be enabled or disabled on a per agency basis.

column.name: feature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a FEATURE that is controlled by the FEATURE_AGENCY_XREF table.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the FEATURE controlled by the flag.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the FEATURE controlled by the flag.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the FEATUREs should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the FEATURE is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the FEATURE.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the FEATURE was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the FEATURE

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the FEATURE was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: gir_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a gir complaint. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: gir_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a type of GIR complaint.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the GIR complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the GIR complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the GIR complaint.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the GIR complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC.

table.name: gir_complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for gir_complaint table

column.name: h_gircmplt_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for GIR complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the GIR complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the GIR complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the GIR complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: hwcr_complaint
table.remarks: A complaint that a caller believes could involve a conflict between Humans and Wildlife.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a hwcr complaint. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: other_attractants_text
column.remarks: Provides a more detailed description when the attractant of type "OTHER" is included.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the HWCR complaint.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the HWCR complaint.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC.

column.name: species_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a wildlife species.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict.

table.name: hwcr_complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for hwcr_complaint table

column.name: h_hwcrcmplt_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for HWCR complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the HWCR complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the HWCR complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the HWCR complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
table.remarks: Modifier that further describes the nature of Human Wildlife Conflict complaints. (E.g. DEADNV = Dead wildlife - no violation suspected; TRAP = Wildlife in trap)

column.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the human wildlife conflict nature code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the human wildlife conflict nature code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: linked_complaint_xref
table.remarks: Provides the ability to link one COMPLAINT to another COMPLAINT. The initial use case for this table is to identify duplicate complaints, however additional linkages maybe possible in the future.

column.name: linked_complaint_xref_guid
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint linkage.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: One half of a linked complaint pair. If the type requires a context of hierarchy, the complaint that is higher in the hierarchy. For example, in the case of duplicate complaints, this would be the complaint that would remain open and where the majority of the information should be contained.

column.name: linked_complaint_identifier
column.remarks: One half of a linked complaint pair. If the type requires a context of hierarchy, the complaint that is lower in the hierarchy. For example, in the case of duplicate complaints, this would be the complaint that would be closed as a duplicate of the parent.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: Flag indicating if the linkage is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint linkage.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint linkage was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint linkage.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint linkage was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: link_type
column.remarks: The type of link between complaints, DUPLICATE or LINK

column.name: app_user_guid_ref
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a user. References the user table in the shared schema.

table.name: linked_complaint_xref_type_code
table.remarks: Code table for different types of complaint link types

column.name: linked_complaint_xref_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a link type between complaints

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the link type

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the link type

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values should be displayed when presented to a user in a list

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: Flag indicating if the link type is active

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the linked complaint type code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the linked complaint type code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: species_code
table.remarks: The species involved in a Human Wildlife Conflict (E.g. BLKBEAR = Black Bear; WOLVERN = Wolverine)

column.name: species_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a wildlife species.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the species code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the species code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the species code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the species code is active.

column.name: legacy_code
column.remarks: The code for the species from the CORS_SPECIES_CODE table in the COORS database.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the species code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the species code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the species code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the species code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: large_carnivore_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator representing if an officer has been enrolled in COMS

table.name: violation_agency_xref
table.remarks: Used to track the relationship type between an agency and a violation code. For example: violation code 'WASTE' is only used by EPO (CEEB) but 'WILDLIFE' is used by both COS and PARKS

column.name: violation_agency_xref_guid
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a relationship type between an agency and a violation code.

column.name: violation_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a violation.

column.name: agency_code_ref
column.remarks: Key representing an agency stored in the agency_code table of the shared schema. Used to map violation types to the NatSuite agency responsible for compliance.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the relationship between an agency and a violation code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship between an agency and a violation code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the relationship between an agency and a violation code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the relationship between an agency and a violation code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the relationship type between an agency and a violation code is active.

table.name: violation_code
table.remarks: The alleged violation involved in the (E.g. ORV = Off Road Vehicles; PESTICDE = Pesticide)

column.name: violation_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a violation.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the violation code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the violation code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the violation code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the violation code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the violation code.

column.name: create_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the violation code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the violation code.

column.name: update_utc_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the violation code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

insert_complaint_update_from_staging(_complaint_identifier character varying, _update_number integer)
